intro: Melanthera confusa, commonly known as the pale blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Melanthera confusa is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
